events.name: Maximum New York April Party & Abundance Politics Accelerator
events.description: ​Come hang out with friends, hear some lightning talks about NYC city/state politics, find collaborators for your own political schemes, and have a good time!​You'll enjoy the company of MNY alumni, people from theabundance movementgenerally, and other guests.​This event will also feature a brief graduation ceremony for several cohorts ofThe Foundations of New York City!​There will be drinks and snacks!​Know before you arrive:This event will be guided by thefour rules of etiquettethat guide all Maximum New York classes, and is generally for people who mostly agree withThe Sensible Seventy.

events.name: OTWC Season 6: Part III
events.description: ​OTWC is an NYC-based writing community for online writers to write, exchange ideas, and get inspired. Our sessions look like this:​​​​​​​​​​​1. ​​​Introduce yourselves and talk about what you plan to write2. ​​​Focused writing session3. ​​​Get together in small groups and discuss how the session went​​​​​​​​​​​Snacks and drinks will be provided!​​​​​​​​​​If this price is too steep for you for any reason, email us by clicking "Contact the Host" on the left and we’ll give you a pay-what-you-can ticket.​​​​​​​​​​​Follow us on Twitter and Instagram @otwc_nyc to stay updated on future events and announcements!​​​​​​​​​​​Hope to see you there 🥳

events.name: Data In Power - NYC Event
events.description: ​Data and the distribution of decision-making power is an increasingly important dynamic to understand and engage with in climate and energy. ​At Data In Power, we believe the method AND end product of data (collection, analysis, and visualization) are critical to decision-making.How are data being collected, analyzed, and presented - why, and by whom? These are the hard-hitting questions we are unpacking.​At this monthly social, we discuss Data In Power fundamentals in a casual setting. Here is avideowith some background on Data In Power's focus within data and the distribution of decision-making power. At all of our events, we gather our community of data and decision-making experts and enthusiasts within climate and energy to share our perspectives.​​Data In Power is an independently run meetup without any bells and whistles.In order to maintain community and continue organic growth, prospective attendees should be prepared to support our meetup venue with a purchase, regardless of how large or small. Data In Power brings folks together through meaningful, productive, and unique programming.

venue.name: Please register to see the exact location of this event.

events.name: 106th NY Hardware Meetup @ Cornell Tech
events.description: ​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 106th NY Hardware Meetup at Cornell Tech​​​​Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.​​​​This month we'll be atCornell Tech. Cornell Tech is  Cornell University’s state-of-the-art campus in New York City that develops leaders and technologies for the AI era through foundational and applied research, graduate education, and new ventures. Located on Roosevelt Island, the growing campus was founded in partnership with the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology and in close collaboration with the NYC Economic Development Corporation after Cornell won a worldwide competition initiated by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration to create an applied sciences campus in New York City. More than 1,000 Cornell students are now educated annually on the campus, including 700 in Cornell Tech programs. Since opening in 2012, nearly 120 new companies have spun out from startup programs at Cornell Tech, and 95 percent of them are based in New York City. Cornell Tech continues to have atransformative economic impact on the region’s tech sector.​​​Welcome Remarks​Niti Parikhis the founding director of Cornell Tech’s academic MakerLAB and an Engaged Faculty Fellow, with over 15 years of experience in Interior Architecture and Sustainable Manufacturing. Her work centers on participatory design in Digital Fabrication, creating inclusive learning environments that empower people of all ages and abilities to bring their ideas to life.​AGENDA​​​​6:30 - Arrival, presentation of student demos​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​​7:15- Community open mic​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on​7:30 - Panel with audience Q+A​​8:40 - Student demos, makerlab tours, mix and mingle​​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

venue.name: Tata Innovation Center11 E Loop Rd, New York, NY 10044, USA

events.name: 105th NY Hardware Meetup @ Viam
events.description: ​​​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 105th NY Hardware Meetup at Viam​​​Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.​​​This month we'll be atViam. Viam helps companies unlock the power of AI, data and automation in the physical world. They provide a single platform for engineers of all disciplines to solve problems together and build solutions that are fast and future-proof. Viam powers solutions across robotics, food and beverage, climate tech, marine, industrial manufacturing, and more. Founded in 2020 by former MongoDB co-founder and CTO Eliot Horowitz, Viam is headquartered in New York City.​SPEAKERS​Esha Maharishi is a Senior Product Manager at Viam, where she leads work on hardware and motion, helping to build tools that make robotics more accessible and flexible for developers. Prior to moving into product, she was the lead engineer for SLAM at Viam, bringing deep technical expertise to critical perception systems. Before Viam, Esha spent over seven years at MongoDB, where she held a range of engineering leadership roles across serverless, sharding, and distributed systems. Her work helped shape the core infrastructure behind one of the most widely used databases in the world. With a rare blend of engineering depth and product strategy, Esha brings a thoughtful and pragmatic lens to building modern tools for robotics and infrastructure.​Jeff Crystal is COO of Voltaic Systems. He is responsible for ensuring successful solar deployments for both low-power embedded hardware applications and remote power systems for industrial equipment. He works with companies across transportation, agriculture, security and monitoring to bring new products and services to life. He lives in Brooklyn, NY. Voltaic Systems (www.voltaicsystems.com) is a full-service provider of remote solar charging solutions. Their smaller solar panels are designed for durability in challenging environments and are integrated into high volume IoT products. Their CORE Solar System is designed to provide scalable power and battery storage for remote networking devices, cameras and environmental monitoring equipment.​​AGENDA​​​6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+A​8:20 - Community open mic​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.​8:30 - Mix + mingle​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: La Creme de la STEM™ x Startup Grind DMV - Walk and Talk
events.description: ​Join La Creme de la STEM™ and Startup Grind for a relaxed evening of networking and conversation at our "Walk and Talk" event, happening during SelectUSA at the Gaylord National Resort & Convention Center. Whether you're an entrepreneur or investor located in the DMV area, or attending SelectUSA, this is your chance to connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build meaningful relationships in a casual, welcoming atmosphere.​This gathering is the perfect opportunity to unwind after a busy day, share your experiences, and explore new opportunities. We look forward to seeing you there!​ABOUT LA CREME DE LA STEM™​​​La Creme de la STEM™is the only global, private network for early-stage female founders in tech and science, offering a holistic support system that includes exclusive insights from exited entrepreneurs, vetted investors and perks from corporate partners.Applyto join!

events.name: 🕯️ Pour & Shake: Candle & Mocktail Making Class
events.description: ​Join us for an evening of Candle & Mocktail Making at Nose Best - Bushwick’s secret speakeasy candle pouring studio!​We’ll kick off the night in the Nose Best store with a glass of (non-alcoholic) prosecco by St Buena Vida before heading to their speakeasy candle studio in the back.​You’ll start by blending your own signature candle scent and hand-pouring a candle to take home. Then, shake things up with a curated mocktail making experience led by Sam from Third Place Bar.​You’ll head home with your ownhandmade candle, afull size bottle of St. Buena Vida bubbly, and agoodie bag of cocktail garnishesfrom Small Batch Cocktail Co to set the mood for your next night in 🥰​Whether you’re sober-curious, alcohol-free, or just looking for a new kind of night out, this cozy, hands-on class is the perfect vibe.​Limited spots available.Come solo, bring a friend, or plan your next date night!​FAQ​​​Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?Yes, please aim to arrive at 6.30pm as we will get started with the class at 7pm and latecomers may not be admitted!​​​​Q: Can I come alone?Yes, you’re welcome to come alone and meet new people!​​​​Q: Is this an alcohol-free venue?Yes, the studio does not serve alcohol.​​​​Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+​​​Q: I need to cancel, can I get a refund for my ticket?Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds, but you're welcome to pass on your ticket to someone else.

venue.name: Nose Best: Candles & Classes96 Knickerbocker Ave Suite 111, Brooklyn, NY 11237, USA
venue.address: 96 Knickerbocker Ave Suite 111, Brooklyn, NY 11237, USA

events.name: Third Place Bar x Shanti House Mindful Friday Night Social
events.description: ​Third Place Bar & Shanti Houseinvite to you a different kind of Friday night out. Join us at the new Fabrik location in Dumbo for a relaxing and slow first timers yoga class (aimed at anyone who isn’t familiar with yoga), a tea bar, non-alcoholic drinks, live DJ, and playful activities to wind down and de-stress from the week... without the hangover.​What to expect:​6.30pm-7pm: Arrivals & mingling(please make sure to arrive on time before the yoga session!)​7pm-7.45pm: Unwind yin yoga led by Louisa, founder ofShanti House​7.45pm-9:00pm: Social hour with NA drinks​FAQ​​Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?Yes, please aim to arrive at 6.30pm as we will get started with the yoga class at 7pm and latecomers may not be admitted!​​​Q: Can I come alone?Yes, this is a social mixer, you’re welcome to come alone and meet new people!​​​Q: Is this an alcohol-free venue?Yes, Fabrik is a community space that does not serve alcohol.​​​Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+​Q: I've never done yoga, can I still come?Yes!! This yoga class is specifically aimed at folks who haven’t done yoga and aren’t familiar with the poses. We’ll keep the poses simple and walk you through them!​Q: Do I need to bring a mat? Can I change somewhere?Yoga mat rental is included in the ticket price, but you're welcome to bring your own! There are limited changing rooms available.​Q: I need to cancel, can I get a refund for my ticket?Unfortunately, we cannot offer refunds, but you're welcome to pass on your ticket to someone else.​​​Please note: By signing up for this event you agree to receive email communication from us. You can opt out any time.

events.name: Sober(Curious) Cinco de Mayo Party
events.description: ​We're back with another hangover-free party, and this time we’re celebrating our Mexican friends & neighbors on Cinco de Mayo! 🇲🇽​Expect cocktail specials with non-alc tequila, infused drinks by Cloudwalker Farm, music, conversation starter cards, and MAYBE the bedazzle station will make a comeback too! ✨​There’s no fixed programming at this event. Come through any time and be ready to mingle with new people!​This event is supported byCloudwalker Farm!​FAQ​​Q: Do I need to be there at the exact start time?No, you can stop by at the party any time!​​​Q: Can I come alone?Yes, this is a social mixer, you’re welcome to come alone and meet new people!​​​Q: Can I bring friends?Yes, but please send them the link to RSVP so we can manage the venue capacity (!!), send them important updates, and ensure a great experience for you all!​​​Q: Is this a sober venue?Yes, Hekate is a 100% sober bar.​​​Q: Is there an age restriction?Yes, all our events are 21+​​​Q: Is there a cover charge?No, there is no cover charge, but we encourage you to purchase drinks to support us and the venue & tip the lovely bar staff so we can continue hosting these kinds of events!​​​

events.name: Gen Z Cafe CoWorking
events.description: ​A mid-week coworking session perfect for those flexible WFH days and startup founders!​Join fellow Gen Z founders, creators, and investors for an energizing February coworking session in East Village. Whether you're building your startup, working on your side hustle, or just want to connect with like-minded creators – this space is for you.​What's GenZtea? 🍵​GenZtea empowers Gen Z founders to unlock their full potential through personal branding, community support, and innovative resources. We're building a global network of young entrepreneurs who are changing the world.​📍 What to Expect:​• A cozy workspace in a vibrant cafe setting​• Meaningful connections with fellow Gen Z entrepreneurs​• Collaborative brainstorming and experience sharing​• Winter-friendly amenities to stay productive​Stay Connected: ✨​Join our newsletter atgenztea.beehiiv.com/subscribefor monthly founder resources, event updates, and community highlights! ✨​Want to be featured in our community spotlight? DM us! 📱​Photo Notice: 📸 This event will be photographed and filmed. By attending, you consent to GenZtea using your image in marketing materials and adding you to the GenZtea newsletter.

events.name: Gen Z NYC Founder & Creator Mixer
events.description: ​As we embrace spring in 2025, take a moment to celebrate your entrepreneurial journey with us in East Village! Join fellow ONE-OF-A-KIND Gen Z founders for an intimate evening of connection, inspiration, and well-deserved self-care at our April mixer.​So what the heck is GenZtea?GenZtea's Mission: Empowering Gen Z founders, creators, and investors to unlock their full potential through personal branding, community support, and innovative resources. We're building a global network of young builders who are not just invited into the room but are leading it.​Want to stay in the loop? Join our brand new newsletter athttps://genztea.beehiiv.com/subscribefor monthly deep dives with Gen Z lens, event updates, and community highlights! Reach is the new resume.​DM me if you are interested in getting featured in newsletter​✨ Brand New​✨: Gen Z Marketplace​DM me on Luma to have your food brand represented IRL at this event!​​🎁 Event Highlights:​​• Network with fellow Gen Z entrepreneurs & creators​​• Share experiences and insights​​• Discover potential collaborations​​• Enjoy refreshments​Want to sponsor? Reach out here on Luma or email natalie@thegenztea.com​​** Please note, this event will be photographed and filmed. By attending this event you consent to your image being used for these purposes and being added to GenZtea newsletter. **

events.name: aci-d trip : folk tales
events.description: ​This a field trip + talk with the team behindfolk.computer, a physical computing system.​The first part will be a demo of the folk system at their studio,  including example programs and a walkthrough of how the system is programmed.​The second part will “folk tales” : a talk and Q&A unpacking the philosophy behind the project, its history, and other folk...lore.We're leaning into the more esoteric, obscure parts of folk, so even if you've been to an open house or tried folk out before, you’ll still walk away with something new.​Generally this trip is geared towards people who havesomecontext on folk.computer and related projects. If you aren't familiar with either, I'd recommend reading up a little beforehand. Here are some links to get you started:dynamicland.org,Geokit,Dynamicland experiments,folk.computer.Tickets are limited, and preference will be given to people who people who have shown up to past aci-d club hangs or events, though we will have some slots open for new faces!​—​Folk Computeris a research & art project, led byOmar RizwanandAndrés Cuervo, centered around designing new physical computing interfaces.Folk Computer is developing a new open-source 'physical computing' system, where you operate the computer by moving physical objects around (instead of laptop/phone/mouse/keyboard/touchscreen). The main Folk installations live at Hex House, a shared artist studio space in East Williamsburg.

events.name: aci-d club weekly hang 024 *we go on hiatus after this one*
events.description: ​WEEKLY HANGS WILL GO ON A HIATUS FOR THE SUMMER!!(though we will still be doing field trips and workshops and parties and stuff here n there)​Have a creative project you’ve been wanting to work on but can’t quite make the time for? Want to meet other designers in the city? Come hang with us!Show up with ideas and materials, leave with progress made, and a new friend or two.AGENDA7:00-7:30: intros7:30-8:30: work on (or start) a design project!8:30-9:00+: break into groups, share your WIPs, chat, mingle—Hosted attelos.haus
